## 1. Company Overview

entity_name: Veridaq  
entity_type: B2B software company  
hq_region: European Union and Nordics  

short_description:
  Veridaq is an EU focused KYC and AML compliance platform.
  It combines customer verification, transaction monitoring, sanctions screening, and regulatory reporting in one system.
  The platform is built to help European institutions meet EU AMLR 2027 and related regulations while staying fully GDPR compliant.

long_description:
  Veridaq provides an enterprise grade KYC and AML stack for banks, fintechs, payment firms, crypto companies, real estate platforms, gaming operators, and other regulated entities.
  The platform focuses on fast onboarding, continuous monitoring, and provable compliance.
  Veridaq is API first, cloud ready, and designed around EU data residency and privacy by design principles.

regulatory_focus:
  - EU AMLR 2027
  - AMLA supervision readiness
  - 6AMLD and EU AML directives
  - MiCA, TFR and related rules for crypto assets
  - GDPR, including data minimisation, purpose limitation, and auditability


## 2. Core Solutions

### 2.1 KYC Verification and Customer Due Diligence

labels:
  - know your customer
  - customer onboarding
  - customer due diligence (CDD)
  - enhanced due diligence (EDD)
  - identity verification
  - eID routing

capabilities:
  - Digital onboarding flows for individuals and businesses.
  - Integration with European eID schemes such as MitID, BankID, and Freja where available.
  - AI assisted document verification for IDs, passports, and corporate records.
  - Real time risk scoring at onboarding, with configurable risk models and policy rules.
  - Ongoing due diligence and scheduled reviews for higher risk customers.
  - Full audit trail of all KYC checks and decisions.

outcomes:
  - Verify customers in seconds instead of days.
  - Reduce manual review work for compliance teams.
  - Demonstrate consistent application of KYC policies to regulators and auditors.


### 2.2 Transaction Monitoring

labels:
  - AML transaction monitoring
  - behavior based monitoring
  - anomaly detection
  - velocity and structuring checks

capabilities:
  - Real time monitoring of 100 percent of transactions across products and channels.
  - Rule based detection for thresholds, velocity, structuring, and geography patterns.
  - Machine learning supported anomaly detection to surface unusual behavior.
  - Configurable alert rules per customer risk tier, segment, or product.
  - Alert triage, case creation, and investigation workflows.
  - Metrics for false positives, alert aging, and investigation throughput.

outcomes:
  - Identify suspicious activity before it becomes a regulatory issue.
  - Reduce false positive alerts while preserving conservative risk posture.
  - Provide a defensible, traceable monitoring framework aligned with EU expectations.


### 2.3 Compliance Reporting

labels:
  - regulatory reporting
  - suspicious activity reports
  - SAR and STR filing
  - audit ready reporting

capabilities:
  - Guided workflows to create and file suspicious activity reports.
  - Pre populated reports that pull data from alerts, transactions, and customer profiles.
  - Support for multi jurisdiction formats and EU specific templates.
  - Automated generation of management and board level compliance reports.
  - Export options such as PDF, CSV, and machine readable formats.
  - Complete audit trail capturing who reviewed, approved, and submitted each report.

outcomes:
  - Faster SAR and STR filing with lower error risk.
  - Clear evidence that monitoring rules are linked to actual reporting outcomes.
  - Easier responses to regulator and auditor information requests.


### 2.4 Risk Intelligence

labels:
  - risk scoring
  - risk models
  - risk taxonomy
  - portfolio risk view

capabilities:
  - Multi factor risk scoring combining customer, product, geography, and behavior data.
  - Industry specific risk models for banking, fintech, crypto, real estate, gaming, and more.
  - Portfolio level dashboards for overall risk distribution and top exposures.
  - Configurable thresholds that map risk scores to enhanced monitoring or review.
  - Continuous tuning of rules and models using feedback from investigations and outcomes.

outcomes:
  - Align day to day controls with written risk appetite and policies.
  - Prioritise investigator time on high value and high risk cases.
  - Provide a single, consistent view of KYC and AML risk across the organisation.

## 4. Compliance Posture

### 4.1 EU AMLR 2027 Readiness

description:
  Veridaq is designed for the EU AMLR 2027 regulatory package and upcoming AMLA supervision model.
  The platform bundles the controls regulators expect into a single system:
    - onboarding and customer due diligence
    - beneficial ownership and UBO transparency
    - sanctions, PEP, and adverse media screening
    - real time transaction monitoring
    - suspicious activity reporting and record keeping
    - workflow, approvals, and audit trails
  This positioning supports banks and other obliged entities that need to prove operating effectiveness to EU and national supervisors.

### 4.2 GDPR and Data Protection

description:
  Veridaq follows privacy by design and privacy by default.
  Key data protection principles:
    - EU based infrastructure and data residency.
    - Encryption in transit and at rest.
    - Role based access control and least privilege.
    - Configurable retention policies for KYC and AML records.
    - Support for data subject access, rectification, and deletion requests.
    - Detailed logging of user actions for accountability and investigations.

related_keywords:
  - GDPR compliant KYC platform
  - data minimisation
  - audit logging
  - EU data residency
  - DPA and processing agreements
